dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No people. A FEW CARS AND TRUCKS are parked at odd angles A TITLE FADES IN, one phrase at a time. FIVE YEARS... SINCE THE DEAD FIRST WALKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear THE SOUND OF A STRONG WIND. DEBRIS flutters throu streets. A LARGE ALLIGATOR slithers into frame, stops and around. MONTAGE: as MORE GATORS explore the empty streets, knocki GARBAGE CANS, upsetting the MANNEQUINS in A DEPARTMENT ST A GATOR crawls out through the open doors of AN ABANDONED BILLS are dragged along under the animal's tail. They flu the WIND.

dialogues.text: GATORS crawl over A '79 CADELLIC. A FEMALE SKELETON sits the steering wheel. In the back a BABY'S BONES are strapp INFANT'S SAFETY SEAT. One of the gators THUMPS its tail m against the windshield. ANOTHER TITLE APPEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SECTION OF PAVEMENT as we hear THE SOUND OF SL FOOTSTEPS approaching. A SHADOW appears at the bottom of It gets longer and takes on the shape of a man. TIGHT ON THE AFTERNOON SUN, blinding us. Into the FOREGRO THE FIGURE which cast the shadow. Glare obscures all faci until the head jogs into position directly in front of th in the sky. Then we see its hideous, dead eyes, its blue- the blackened wound where a large portion of jaw has been away. This is a ZOMBIE! A MUSIC CHORD SOUNDS and THE MAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAD CREDITS ROLL over A MONTAGE: the CITY STREETS are no by the WALKING DEAD. In every shape, size and colour they without purpose, up and down the avenues, in and out of b The city is theirs, they have inherited the place. Man, i form, seems to be gone. As the CREDITS END, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking down from a HIGH ANGLE. The corner of A TA is in the FOREGROUND. A CORPSE is dangling from A NOOSE. dead for some time. It's mostly bone now, its blackened f clean by scavenger birds and harbour rats. A SIGN flaps a chest cavity. Its hurriedly scrawled message reads: TAKE

dialogues.speaker: LOVE YOU
dialogues.text: THE ROPE BREAKS suddenly and THE CORPSE FALLS out of fram

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at GROUND LEVEL now...SMACK!!! THE CORPSE HITS THE SHATTERS as though made of potter's clay. BONES bounce ov area. THE SIGN is carried off by the WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SIGN gallops across the grass of A HARBOUR PARK towar where A FEW DERELICT BOATS sway in the WIND. Slowly, THE SOUND OF A MOTOR FADES IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FISHING BOATS, old and sea-worn, chugs into the harbour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people on board, THREE MEN AND TWO WOMEN. They guerilleros from somewhere in Latin America. They're heav unshaven, covered with months worth of jungle crud. They obviously exhausted. They gaze up to the city. Their deep are too war-weary to show much emotion but we can read th

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Another dead place. I tol' you. Let's get  out to the islands.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: The radio signals were coming from this  area.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not from the city. In every city it's the  same. Dead. Let's get out to the barrier  islands. If there are survivors sending  those signals that's where we'll find them.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Plenty of time for the islands. The rest of  our...life...on the islands...I think. Miguel is drifting. The sight of the dead city has pushed inches closer to the brink of insanity. He catches himsel back toward reality.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: We gotta see if there are others here. We  came all this way. We're gonna check it  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OPEN GASOLINE RECEPTACLE in the hull of AN A BOAT. A WOMAN'S HANDS shove a LENGTH OF HOSE down into th The woman, MARIA, puts the other end of the hose to her m sucks the air out. At ANOTHER DERELICT BOAT, TONY sucks on ANOTHER HOSE.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ptoooo! Nothing! Dry as a bone. No gas.  Let's get outa here.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Check them all. And check the tanks under  the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL and the other two guerilleros, SARAH AND CHICO, st up the dock towards the harbour park, toward the city. MI ELECTRONIC BULLHORN in one hand, his AUTOMATIC RIFLE read other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TRIO of refugees move across the grass. The WIND blow around them as they stare towards the downtown buildings. lifts THE BULLHORN to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: as THE WALKING DEAD hear that human VOICE. Throu city they turned towards THE SOUND, at once confused and MIGUEL (o.s.) HELLOOOOOOOOOOO.... THE DEAD start to GROAN hungrily, almost pleadingly. All city their VOICES RISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes to MIGUEL AND THE OTHERS as A MASSIVE WALL OF NO SOUND of hundreds-of-thousands of damned souls moaning on voice. The sound of hell on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY AND MARIA hear it as well and feel the familiar grip fear. Maria makes the sign of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Dios mia.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I tol' him. I tol' him this is a dead  place. Like all the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the place FROM A GREAT DISTANCE. In the FOREGROUND BOAT, with all five REFUGEES back on board, chugs into op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the city, this dock is wooden, rickety. DERELIC at their moorings. THE FISHING BOAT is tied-on at one end and THE GUERILLEROS are moving through the area, scavengi time CHICO helps MARIA with the SIPHON HOSES. TONY linger near the fishing boat which has its motor still idling. MARIA'S SIPHON HOSE is stuffed into the gas tank of A LAR She sucks on the hose and, unexpectedly, foul tasting liq her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: AY
dialogues.text: Without warning, A FIGURE pops up from behind the side wa trawler. He reaches out and grabs the woman, pulling her boat, his arm around her neck, a pistol to her head. TONY sees the action. He dives into the fishing boat, cra his RIFLE and scrambles towards the pilot's controls. With a lightning move, MARIA pulls A KNIFE from her belt. wrenches around and PLUNGES THE BLADE INTO HER ATTACKER'S man staggers back, screaming. MARIA breaks away and runs dock. THE MAN FIRES HIS PISTOL wildly. MARIA IS HIT IN THE ARM. She tumbles forwards onto the de TONY reacts, OPENING FIRE WITH HIS AUTOMATIC.

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS RIP INTO THE ATTACKERS CHEST
dialogues.text: onto the dock, but TWO MORE GUNMEN appear behind him, mea desperadoes with RIFLE SPITTING LEAD. TONY ducks as low as he can. He grabs the controls and pi fishing boat along the edge of the dock toward the downed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL, SARAH AND CHICO react to the gunfire. They draw t and look for cover. They are at the far end of the dock, their backs to the s a WORK SHED nearby. BULLETS WHIZ past them as they charge wooden structure. They make it there safely and they begi FIRE. A gun battle ensues between the two groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIA, her ARM BLEEDING, rolls off the dock and into THE BOAT. TONY guns the engine and the boat pulls out into op THE ATTACKERS try to FIRE AT THE ESCAPING BOAT but they a duck BULLETS which RICOCHET OFF THE TRAWLER pinning them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL'S RIFLE is in his right hand. His left hand clings frame of AN OPEN WINDOW on his side of the shed. There's STARTLING MUSIC STING and, with it, A ZOMBIE appears insi window. Grotesque and drooling dark SALIVA, its hungry mo at MIGUEL'S left arm. ITS TEETH TEAR A LARGE STRIP OF FLE THE ARM six inches above the wrist. MIGUEL screams. He pulls away from the creature, his terr staring at the BLEEDING WOUND. A zombie bite means infect almost certain death. THE ZOMBIE leans out through the open window, its hands c air trying to reach MIGUEL. SARAH pulls A GIANT .45 from belt. BULLAMN! BULLAMN! BULLAMN! She FIRES three rapid sh THE SKULL OF THE ZOMBIE INDENTS IN FRONT like a hard-boil that's been whacked with a spoon bowl. BLACKENED BLOOD AN MATTER FLIES OUT OF THE BACK where the bullets exit. The falls, destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH acts quickly. She lunges towards CHICO and snatches out of his belt. CHICO shows concern but he's busy RETURN THE ATTACKERS on the trawler.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I have to stop the infection... Querrida...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL looks into SARAH'S eyes. He has started to tremble primal panic is gurgling up in his throat. With a sudden slams her RIFLE BUTT into the side of his head with all h reels backwards and slams into the boathouse wall. His ey he stays on his feet, still conscious. CHICO steps away from his post and stands squarely in fro MIGUEL. WHAP! He slugs him with a powerhouse right-cross. still stands. WHAP! He slugs him again. WHAP! Again. Fina collapses into the man's arms and CHICO lays the limp bod the deck. BUDDABLAM! RATTATATTATATTATATT! THE ENEMY, sensing an upp starts FIRING WITH MORE INTENSITY. CHICO steps away from SENDS SOME LEAD BACK their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH is crying. It's not weakness. She's crying for MIGU for his pain. But she doesn't hesitate in what she has to crouches over the BITTEN ARM and raises the MACHETE over THUCK! SHE CHOPS AT THE ELBOW JOINT with all her strength

dialogues.speaker: BITES DEEP BUT DOESN'T CUT THROUGH. SHE LIFTS IT AND CHOP
dialogues.text: AGAIN....THUCK! THUCK! Then SHE DIGS AROUND, searching fo the way she might on a turkey drumstick. Finding the spot DOWN WITH BOTH HANDS, leaning all her weight on the top e blade. TEARS are running down her cheeks when THE BIG KNI FINALLY.... THUMMMPPP!....CUTS THROUGH TO THE DECKING. Repulsed, angry, SARAH SWEEPS THE SEVERED FOREARM AWAY WI the way a butcher might sweep away unwanted fat. BLOOD IS OUT OF THE STUMP at an alarming rate. SARAH has to act qu While CHICO continues to RETURN FIRE at the enemy, SARAH herself up onto the sill of the open boathouse window and inside the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dark and cluttered (oars, bait buckets, fish life preservers, tools, paints, varnishes). SARAH snatche HANDLE. THE ZOMBIE that bit Miguel lies nearby with its skull lai hand is jogged, startingly, when SARAH grabs A BOTTLE OF THINNER from the floor beside the corpse. From out of the shadows...A HAND! It grabs SARAH'S ankle. violently and pulls away. ANOTHER ZOMBIE is crawling acro floor. ONE OF ITS LEGS IS MISSING AND THE OTHER IS BADLY SARAH draws her .45 and BULLAMM! BULLAMM! SHE PUMPS TWO R THE CREATURE'S BRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO ducks the enemy's RICOCHETING BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: GUNS.
dialogues.text: At THE TRAWLER, ONE OF THE ATTACKERS shouts a response.

dialogues.speaker: ATTACKER
dialogues.text: You could use our guns, maybe. We can't use  yours. Unless you can get yer boat back  here.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: You got a boat.

dialogues.speaker: ATTACKER
dialogues.text: Shit, man. We can drift this tub into the  bay...tow her around with a dinghy...but  she ain't gonna get us nowhere. Ev'ry boat  you see here is long dead, soldier...else  we'd be long gone. Can you get your boat  back here?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: I don't know where they went, man. I don't  know. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: ATTACKER
dialogues.text: Then, like I said...we can't use you. We  ain't got the food nor the patience to put  up with you. The man FIRES A LONG BURST from his automatic.

dialogues.speaker: YOU....YOU MOTHERFUCKERS
dialogues.text: He reaches around the corner of the shed with his own rif blind in return. SARAH clambers out through the shed wind wrapped A LARGE PIECE OF CLOTH around the end of the AXE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into a shirt pocket and produces A WOODEN MAT strikes the match and touches the flame to the thinner-so PHOOOOOMPH! The axe handle becomes an angrily flaming tor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the gun battle continues, SARAH crouches over MIGUEL. STILL FOUNTAINING FROM THE STUMP OF HIS LEFT ARM. The wom FLAMING END OF HER TORCH ONTO THE STUMP. There's A SIZZLI the raw flesh there cooks. The pain reaches MIGUEL even though his unconscious state to breathe heavily. His head shakes from side to side sil pleading "NO, NO, NO." The flames do their job. THE FLESH AND THE BLEEDING STOPS. MIGUEL'S SHIRT CATCHES. Suddenly his eyes pop open and he like the man on fire he is. He lurches away from the flam slamming against the shed wall. SARAH flings the torch in and dives on top of the man.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUELITO. MI VIDA. MIGUEL MIO.
dialogues.text: MIGUEL, trying to scream but needing to vomit, is doing n body is convulsing in the woman's arms. She rubs the spar shirt until they disappear then she caresses him, holding against hers, rocking him back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO is still busy RETURNING FIRE. BULLETS WHIZ through around his head. ONE KNICKS HIM ON THE SHOULDER, a superf painful wound.

dialogues.speaker: HELL UP HERE
dialogues.text: SARAH has no choice but to help in the fight. She lays MI gently as she can on his back. He's gone into deep shock, violently. Rubbing tears away from her eyes, SARAH jumps takes up a post and begins to FIRE AT THE ATTACKERS. THE ATTACKERS are grinning like old-fashioned pirates as CHEW UP THE DOCK. Suddenly, just behind THE TRAWLER, we s OF COLOUR SPEEDING BY... It's THE FISHING BOAT! The WOUNDED MARIA is steering. TON standing on the prow with his RIFLE FIRING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE PITCHES FORWARDS, FALLING between the boat and the doc water below. THE OTHER ATTACKER (#1) turns and FIRES IN RESPONSE. TONY THE STOMACH. He falls to his knees and grabs the side of he KEEPS FIRING. THE ATTACKER pivots against a mast. For a moment he doesn that HIS NECK HAS BEEN RIPPED OPEN BY A LINE OF BULLETS. scream. Can't. A PLUME OF RED SHOOT OUT OF HIS MOUTH. The realises. He realises that he's a dead man. He falls.

dialogues.speaker: PULL IN
dialogues.text: TONY is clutching at his BLEEDING BELLY as MARIA, in pain own wound, circles the boat towards the edge of the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the boathouse, SARAH slings her rifle onto her sho she leans over MIGUEL who is now catatonic.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Help me get him to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Leave him. SARAH calmly raises her .45 and aims it directly at CHICO

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Help me or die. Reluctantly the man moves towards MIGUEL and the two surv his limp body over the decking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fishing boat is gone. Orange light from the western h paints the scene. FIGURES are moving about on the dock, s lumbering figures....ZOMBIES. They're clustering around THE TRAWLER, around THE CORPSES ATTACKERS.

dialogues.speaker: THEY BEGIN PULLING THOSE CORPSES APART AND EATING THEM HU
dialogues.text: ONE CREATURE has found MIGUEL'S SEVERED FOREARM. IT PULLS OFF THE THING WITH ITS TEETH. It chews for a time, ITS DR RED. Then it spits out MIGUEL'S WRISTWATCH as though it w bothersome bit of bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TWO WOMEN hover over their wounded, TONY AND MIGUEL. the boat. Suddenly, TONY arches his back and screams in p

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaah...my God...my God...I am heartily  sorry...for having offended  Thee....offended Thee...

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Shhhhh....Tony. Rest, rest.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I detest all my sins...because... because  of Thy just punishment... because of  Thy...just...punish... A coughing fit interrupts his Act of Contrition. From acr cabin, from within SARAH'S arms, MIGUEL stares. His eyes glaze of a madman's eyes. Despite that, and despite the p trauma he has endured, he seems remarkably in command.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: He is dying. I will end his pain. MIGUEL draws his PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ...but most of all because...they offend  Thee, my God...Who art all good...and  deserving...deserving of all my love...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: He is dying. He knows it.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: You are dying, too.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: No. The disease was cut away from me. I  will live. I will live.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I firmly resolve...with the... with the  help...the help of...of Thy grace... TONY collapses. A long, gurgling breath of surrender spil him and BLOOD TRICKLES FROM HIS LIFELESS MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Tony...TONY! The woman folds TONY'S corpse into her arms as though try it life from her own wounded body. For a long moment ther the CHUG-CHUG-CHUG of the tired engine. Then the woman, s something, turns back towards MIGUEL. His pistol is raise TONY'S head.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It must be done. You know this. It must by  done to keep him from...

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: It won't happen to him! It won't happen to  him! You heard his prayer. His prayer will  save him. He could never become one  of...one of those... devils.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Prayers have no power to save. The knife  can save. It can cut the disease away. The  bullet. It can shatter the brain where the  evil takes seed. These are saviours...our  new saviours...our only saviours.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: We must wait. One day the curse will pass.  One day a dead man will... will...

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: One day a dead man will refuse to return,  and that man will be a saint. The first  saint of our century. That's a prayer, too.  A catechism. Something the priests tell us  to believe.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: You can believe this, Miguel. I'll kill you  if you shoot. We must wait. I'll....I'll do  it....I'll do it myself....when it needs to  be done.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: No. You won't be able to do it. He will  rise. He will rise and you... you will die. That madman's glaze is wet in MIGUEL'S eyes again. A grin mouth into an odd shape. He freezes, staring, waiting. SA concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRESCENT MOON lies on its back. Below, on the pitch bla its reflection, a vertical stripe, breaks open as THE BOA through it...CHUG-CHUG-CHUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO has fallen asleep at the tiller. SARAH is asleep as so is MARIA. A SILENT SHADOW moves over the side rail. HANDS reach out MARIA'S shoulders, lifting her up, up from sleep. Her eye open. TONY'S face is blue-grey in the moonlight. It takes the w second or two to recognise that HE IS ONE OF THE LIVING D hungry mouth lunges towards her neck. His DROOLING TEETH The woman screams. SARAH wakes with a start. MIGUEL is already awake. He's b all along. Now he watches still, his PISTOL idle in his o hand, his mouth curled in that strange grin, as MARIA'S s shatter the quiet night. At the tiller, CHICO sees what's happening. He fumbles fo AUTOMATIC RIFLE that's strapped over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TEETH OF THE TONY-CREATURE. BLOOD SQUIRTS UPWARD IN A FIV
dialogues.text: SARAH lifts her RIFLE from her lap. She is the first to F instant later, CHICO FIRES as well.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAD ON THE TONY-CREATURE IS HIT BY RAPID-FIRE LOADS
dialogues.text: gun and IT COME APART ABOVE THE EYES. Its body staggers s MARIA. She tries to stand, tries to pull away, screams st in her torn throat. She topples backward over the side ra corpse, taller and heavier, flips rigidly over, its feet skyward, and splashes in to the deep, black Gulf.  MARIA, the small of her back balanced precariously on the grabs at the air trying to swing her weight back on board springs forward. She reaches the other woman a second too hands brush but don't catch. MARIA slips over the side. A CUTS OFF HER SCREAMS. CHICO brings the boat about in as tight a circle as possi SARAH stare out over the water. The blackness out there i Visibility zero. Silence....but for the CHUG-CHUG-CHUG of the boat's engin MIGUEL slowly raises his hand and aims his PISTOL at a LA SHAPED SPLOTCH OF BLOOD on the hull across the cabin, the TONY died. With that odd grin still on his lips, HE BEGIN one shot at a time in deliberate, slow rhythm. THE BULLETS PUNCH HOLES through the wooden side-wall, mos hitting squarely in the blood stain. SARAH looks over toward CHICO who returns her look with f eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a tropical paradise. Greatly separated from smaller islands on the horizon, its vegetation is dense a There's no sign that civilisation ever invaded the place, lines, no buildings. What meets the eye is all natural an THE FISHING BOAT chugs into a tidewater basin on the afte of the island.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: It looks uninhabited. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: I think we should burn the church. Kill the  priest and burn the church. It's the only  way. The only way. MIGUEL is sweating profusely yet shivering as though cold BUZZING in a cluster around his WRAPPED STUMP. He's over now, insane. And worse than that, the infection from the bite is spreading. The amputation was not done quickly en prevent the parasites from racing through his veins to th elsewhere. SARAH turns towards the madman once her lover. Her heart callused for emotion to reach it. She just stares, her ey like the eyes of a shark.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: I'm pullin' in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOAT noses into a swamp water backwash. Tall reeds an moss camouflage it completely. It's at though the boat is right onto dry land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWOCK! CLOSE ON A MACHETE. The blade chops into the top coconut. CHICO drinks the milk. SARAH sits on a nearby rock, her R BACK-PACK full of supplies strapped over her shoulders. MIGUEL, his madman's eyes wide with excitement, is trotti from spot to spot where a spectacular specie of sub-tropi grows. There are hundreds of them, six-feet tall and flow red-gold blossoms are shaped like trumpets hanging with t down.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH shrugs, not knowing. CHICO looks down at her, empat

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: His madness....could be from shock.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. I didn't stop the infection in time. I  know. (She speaks softly, matter-of-factly) Don't worry. When he dies, I won't be like  Maria. I'll shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUERILLEROS hack their way through thick undergrowth MACHETES. MIGUEL is ineffectual. He lags behind the other doing trailblazing. THE SOUNDS OF WILDLIFE, excited by th fill the close, humid air, sometimes beautiful, sometimes sometimes startling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLIGATORS lurk and SNAKES slither among the reeds. A FOU GATOR opens its jaws wide making a SOUND LIKE ESCAPING ST draws his PISTOL but SARAH reaches out to grab his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. No shooting. Not until we're sure we're  alone on this island.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: No. No, thank you. No ice. Straight up,  please. No ice. Thank you. MIGUEL'S eyes roll up into his head. His knees buckle. SA him under the arms barely keeping from falling face first muddy swamp water. CHICO comes to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TWO drag MIGUEL to the edge of dry land. They flop hi back and SARAH puts her canteen to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: NO ICE, I SAID
dialogues.text: He slams his good hand against the canteen, knocking it a plops into the marsh water, its contents lost.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Burn the church. Kill the priest and burn  the church. Burn.... His mouth keeps on shaping words but no sound comes out. for a moment, then he seems to fall asleep. CHICO looks down at him. Unable to help, he moves off tow ground and disappears in the thick brush. After a time, S after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO is at the edge of a clearing when SARAH reaches him are wide, frightened by what they see. In the ground before them there's AN ENORMOUS IRON PLATE, by ten, all painted in brown and green camouflage pattern

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: I dunno. Landing pad for a helicopter? I  dunno. Suddenly there's A GREAT RUMBLING, like the giant gears a of a drawbridge being activated. The iron plate shudders to move, downward, into the earth. SARAH AND CHICO duck i nearby jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take cover in a thicket, both their GUNS up and read SOUNDS can be heard now, clunking sounds of metal on meta heavy thuds. There are also VOICES on the wind but their indistinguishable.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: It's some kind of....elevator. There must  be something under the ground  here....maybe....military.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL FIGURES are rising up in to view, a dozen, maybe Details are obscured by FOREGROUND FOLIAGE but we can rea heavy armaments, packs, utility belts. The impression is cadre of soldiers rising from hell. SARAH (o.s.) Jesus Christ! CHICO (o.s.) It is military. I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: What do we do? Let'em know we're here....or  what?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let's just....wait a minute. Get a better  look. She moves to another spot a few feet away. CHICO follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PLATOON OF SOLDIERS, still obscured by foliage, moves the jungle carrying A COLLECTION OF PARAPHERNALIA. There are THREE SOLDIERS who do not move off with the oth are standing still with their shoulders slumped, their he listlessly from side to side. They have the body attribut prisoners yet there's something menacing about them. We H OF ELECTRONIC BEEPS, something like computer beeps, and, response to that signal, the three slumped figures start They move slowly, stiffly, their feet shuffling, their ar lifelessly at their sides. SARAH (o.s.) Oh....oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH'S eyes are wide in their sockets with disbelief, re horror. Beside her CHICO, also astonished, makes the sign cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we CUT IN CLOSER we see that the three slumped figures ZOMBIES. They are wearing khakis and they are armed with PISTOL BELTS. Their HELMETS have been painted an identify RED and they wear slipover vests dyed the same bright col All the others in the platoon are humans. They, too, wear theirs are not red but WHITE, WITH LARGE ORANGE CIRCLES e front and back. Two of the men wield LONG ELECTRIC CATTLE use should the ZOMBIES misbehave, but the creatures, amaz shambling along with the rest of the platoon voluntarily, operatively, even somewhat excitedly....the kind of excit in a puppy that's just learned a new trick.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: It can't be. Are we truly in hell?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on. Stealthily the woman moves along the edge of the thicket, all the while. CHICO hesitantly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mysterious PLATOON begins "setting up" their equipmen includes TRIPOD MACHINE GUNS. TWO MEN don BLACK RUBBER GL LONG BLACK LABORATORY APRONS. They strap LARGE REFRIGERAT around their necks and open the sealed lids. VAPOUR mushr like dry-ice vapour out of Good Humour wagons on a hot da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH AND CHICO watch. Suddenly THE HUGE, FULL-THROATED S SIREN startles them. They look around, up into the trees. something and points. CLOSE ON A SIREN HORN, high in the cypresses, its wires r to the brush and disappearing under ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First ONE comes....then TWO MORE....THREE MORE. ZOMBIES a out of the jungle and converging on the platoon. They seem to come from everywhere. Soon there are twenty Most are tattered and ragged but others wear vests, the s worn by the platoon. These are solid colours, some white, None are red and none have orange circles. As THE ZOMBIES push in closer they seem to get agitated. growling and reaching out. THE MEN WITH THE CATTLE PRODS more unruly creatures and ZAPPING SOUNDS can be heard. The creatures form a kind of ragged queue, lining up in f "Good Humour" men. From inside their freezer cartons thos produce GREAT BLOODY CHUNKS OF RAW MEAT. THE ZOMBIES doci the hand-outs and go lurching out of the queue, some star immediately, others retreating into the cool of the jungl more private supper.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is that? Could that be....? Behind her, CHICO gets the dry heaves. He slams his hand mouth to keep from making noise.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. They must have gotten them to  accept....other things. They wouldn't be  feeding them with....they wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in command of the platoon is obvious, strutting a others do the dirty work. This is CAPTAIN RHODES. He's  conscienceless, the low of the low, and a weasely-looking boot. He watches the operation almost hoping for trouble. to torture disobedient zombies.) Behind him, their AUTOMATICS ready, are SEVERAL TROOPERS assigned to protect the captain. One of these troopers is a good guy. TOBY is revulsed by the scene in the clearing his head, almost gagging. RHODES notices.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: You'll get used to this, Tyler. It's the  only way. They don't bite the hand that  feeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY looks up. He can't conceal his contempt for the capt reads it in his eyes and is about to say something when a distracts him. ONE OF THE RAG-TAG ZOMBIES is running amok. THE ZAPPERS p creature but that just makes it angrier.

dialogues.speaker: BRING IT HERE
dialogues.text: ONE TROOPER has A LONG POLE WITH A WIRE NOOSE ON THE END. the noose over the wild zombie's head and the wire tighte into the dead flesh on the thing's neck. The pole is long control the creature while keeping it out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH watches, repulsed but fascinated. CHICO is still fi heaves. Without warning, A ZOMBIE looms up directly behin man jumps forward, terrified. He crashes into SARAH who s sees the danger. TWO MORE ZOMBIES appear. Then A THIRD. These have no vest rag-tag, bad ass and hungry as hell. ONE OF THEM grabs SA manages to pull away but behind her CHICO panics. He rais and...RATTATATTATATT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHODES hears the GUNFIRE. He seems pleased. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: We have visitors. Let's go men. He moves slowly towards the thicket followed by TOBY TYLE SEVERAL OTHER SOLDIERS. He reaches down to his belt and p THREE BUTTONS on A UNIT that resembles a pager. ELECTRONI like the ones we heard earlier, come from the unit, this different pattern. THE RED COAT ZOMBIES respond quickly. They draw their PIS marching off after their leader, grunting and snorting li apes. RHODES' grin breaks into a wide-open laugh.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Hah! If only the rest of you ladies would  obey orders the way they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their cover blown, SARAH now raises her RIFLE. BUDDABUDDA THE SECOND ZOMBIE'S HEAD TURNS TO RED PULP and the thing forward, dead. CHICO FIRES and THE THIRD ZOMBIE IS DESTROYED. Suddenly there is DISTANT FIRE, from the clearing. BULLET through the brush. The guerilleros duck for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RED COAT ZOMBIES, shuffling forward abreast in a line OPENED FIRE. It's a grisly parody of foot-soldiering. The are unsteady on their feet, their hands shake when they s stiff Army-issue triggers. BULLETS FLY this way and that, them grossly off target.

dialogues.speaker: BETTER...GETTING BETTER, YOU SCUM
dialogues.text: The trooper beside TOBY is another young man whose nickna TRICKS. He and TOBY exchange glances as they trudge along captain and his zombie red coats. Their eyes tell us that think Rhodes to be insane, which of course he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH moves to retreat but CHICO lifts his rifle and FIRE into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO OF THE RED COATS ARE HIT, but not in the head. Their functioning and they march on.

dialogues.speaker: SPREAD OUT, MEN
dialogues.text: Whatever else he is, RHODES seems fearless. He stands in his human soldiers fan out. He notices that the RED COATS ammunition. He pushes another button on his belt unit and SOUND. THE RED COATS stop in their tracks. They dump the from their weapons and reload using fresh rounds from the Their fingers are stiff. Three bullets fall to the ground one that finds its way into a gun chamber. The SOLDIERS HAVE OPENED FIRE NOW. They are closing in on thicket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO IS HIT high on the right side of his chest. SARAH F BURST out into the clearing as she tries to pull the man the jungle. Suddenly, from right behind SARAH's back, comes A BLOOD C SCREAM. A DARK FIGURE LOOMS UP startling us all.

dialogues.speaker: BURN THE CHURCH
dialogues.text: It's MIGUEL, sweating, his eyes sunken into deep black so charging toward the clearing with his AUTOMATIC BLAZING i good hand. He thunders right past SARAH almost knocking h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIGUEL breaks out of the thicket into clear view of the S RHODES sees the one-armed wild man and his grin dissipate He draws his own PISTOL, an enormous Magnum, an elephant SOLDIERS, taken by surprise, scatter, TOBY AND TRICKS amo MIGUEL'S BULLETS DRAW A LINE ACROSS ONE SOLDIER'S CHEST. instantly.

dialogues.speaker: BURN
dialogues.text: NOW MIGUEL IS HIT but he keeps coming, his GUN SPITTING. ANOTHER SOLDIER goes down, HIT IN THE MID SECTION. THE PLATOON RETURNS FIRE. MIGUEL IS HIT SQUARELY IN THE CHEST. He falls to his knee FIRES A LINE OF BULLETS INTO THE EARTH and the kicking of knocks him back on his ass. He sits there bewildered for then he looks up to find himself directly facing CAPTAIN RHODES lifts his MAGNUM but MIGUEL is faster with his RIF next instant the muzzle is aiming straight for the captai RHODES' smile disappears, re-placed by a sudden flush of freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Kill the priest. MIGUEL squeezes the trigger and his weapon CLICKS sharply empty. The captain's smile slowly returns. He pushes the "Attack his belt unit. THE RED COATS advance, their PISTOLS reloaded. THEY FIRE, and fumble-fingered, at MIGUEL. He sees them moving towar Something in his mind clicks and he recognises the creatu they are...walking dead. THE FIRST FEW BULLETS MISS. Then ONE HITS HIM IN HIS STUM reality gets even clearer. He starts to scream. THE READ COATS walk closer, their dead eyes showing enjoy sport. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER ROUND HITS MIGUEL IN THE STOMACH. ANOTHER CREASES
dialogues.text: He tries to stand up but he's too weak. A BULLET IN THE N his screaming. Then HE'S HIT IN THE HEART. A BALL OF BLOO OUT OF HIS MOUTH and he plops onto his back, dead. THE READ COATS KEEP FIRING until their guns are empty aga calmly pushes the "Reload" signal and the creatures obey. MIGUEL'S CORPSE twitches for a short time, then goes rigi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH sinks against a cypress when she sees MIGUEL die. CHICO, in a state of blind panic, takes off along the edg thicket, his WOUND BLEEDING PROFUSELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO breaks through some brush to find himself face-to-f TOBY TYLER'S GROUP OF SOLDIERS. He stops, reverses course into a cluster of palms. ONE OF THE SOLDIERS FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: RATTATATTATATTATATT
dialogues.text: BULLETS RIP THE PALM FRONDS APART. There's a scream and C somersaults out into view. NEW WOUNDS BLEEDING ACROSS THE HIS CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH realises that this is her last chance to escape. Sh advantage of the confusion and the NOISE and bolts into t a full run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICO is still alive. He fumbles for his HOLSTERED PISTOL he can draw it THREE TROOPERS are on top of him. TRICKS t on his hand. TOBY TYLER aims his RIFLE squarely at his sw

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Yes...yes, do it...please...you can't let  me die this way...please. Destroy me. A  bullet...in the head...I don't want to  become...one of...one of them. TOBY looks down at the man, at his TERRIBLE WOUNDS, clear ones. TOBY clicks a shell into the firing chamber of his finger is just sliding under the trigger shield when CAPT strides up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Take his weapon, Tyler. TOBY is startled by the voice at his back. He turns towar captain, then he looks back down at the guerillero, hesit

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Take his gun, ass hole. He still has the  strength to pull a trigger. Reluctantly TOBY obeys, reaches down for CHICO'S PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Please...senor...destroy me...one  bullet...please.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Maybe. We'll have a little talk first.  Then....maybe...I can help you out. String  him up. THE THIRD SOLDIER reaches down and grabs the wounded guer the arms. TRICKS stoops to help. CHICO screams in agony w moved. TOBY lunges in to help the others, thinking to eas pain.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: They can handle it, Tyler. You've been  buckin' for a shit detail lately so here's  one you're gonna love. We've got two dead.  Cut the heads off and get the bodies  underground to the refrigerators. Fast.  It's a hot day. TOBY grimaces but doesn't speak. He turns and moves brisk the clearing. RHODES watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY nears the spot where MIGUEL lies sprawled in A POOL RHODES calls from the edge of the thicket.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Tyler. Just our men. Not him. TOBY looks down at the remains of the one-armed gueriller

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: His head stays where it is. He and I never  really had the chance to get acquainted.  When he comes back...I'll get another shot  at it... Ha ha ha ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CHICO. He's dangling from A ROPE which is tied o tree, his feet ten feet off the ground. ZOMBIES wander here and there. They've all received their The picnic is breaking up now. Occasionally one of them g but it doesn't amount to anything. SOLDIERS stand ready w PRODS, OTHERS with GUNS. PARAPHERNALIA is being packed away. MEN CARRY EQUIPMENT i direction of the elevator. RHODES walks up beneath where CHICO is hanging. He's care step in too close. He doesn't want to get any DRIPPING BL uniform.

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Please....shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: And if I don't? If I don't you'll come back  after your death. You'll come back and find  yourself hanging there...wanting to  eat...needing to eat human flesh. You hate  that thought, don't you? That's the  ultimate sin for most of you fools, isn't  it? CHICO is weeping now. With a found spurt of energy he str against the rope. No use. It only brings pain.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: After hanging up there a few days you will  be mad for food...crazed! You will lust for  it! YOU WILL BE WORSE THAN ANY OF THEM!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I'll bargain with you. How many of you are  on the island?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Two of us...only two of us...me...and him.  (He nods towards MIGUEL'S CORPSE.)

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I don't believe you, rebel. Where are your  headquarters? On the mainland?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: The mainland...is dead...a dead  place...nobody there...

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Where are your headquarters, rebel? Tell me  or I'll let you hang there  forever...FOREVER!

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: There are no...headquarters. There are  no...rebels. Only the walking dead. Don't  you see. They have won.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Then why did you come here?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: To look...look for a place...a place to  live in...an empty place...a...  new...place...

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: How did you know we were on this island? Do  others know? Will others come?

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Nooooo. Believe me. There are no  others...no rebels...nobody...it's  over...it's ooooo.... The man collapses, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: THE DISEMBODIED HEAD OF ONE OF THE DEAD SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: dropping the thing into A LARGE PLASTIC BAG which obvious contains THE SECOND HEAD. TOBY wraps the mouth of the bag to walk off. RHODES stops him.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: My..."detail", sir. We're going to bury the  heads.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: No time for that. I'll take care of them.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Just....following procedure, sir. They're  entitled to burial.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I said, I'll take care of them. Just leave  them there. Go help with the rest of the  gear. RHODES has it in for TOBY (we'll find out why later), and the feeling is mutual. TOBY sets the bag down on the grou seething, he trots off towards the rest of the platoon. T follows. After a moment, RHODES motions with his head. THE SOLDIER LONG NOOSE POLE steps into view with the CAPTIVE ZOMBIE, ran amok earlier. The man follows RHODES towards the jung the gurgling creature along, the wire noose digging into neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE: as RHODES' GLOVED HAND jams A HAND GRENADE into TH ZOMBIE'S gaping mouth. THE SOLDIER WITH THE POLE releases and the two men take off, running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run to the middle of the clearing where they turn ar watch. RHODES lifts A PAIR OF BINOCULARS that are strappe neck. He stares through the lenses, focusing, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS: We see THE ZOMBIE staggering in t clawing desperately at the thing jammed in its mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY AND TRICKS are the only ones who seem to notice what done. TOBY drops THE CRATE he was going to carry off. He disbelief, hatred on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as THE HEAD OF THE ZOMBIE DISINTEGRATES WHEN TH EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHODES grins as he watches the spectacle. Suddenly, A LOUD GUNSHOT startles the captain. He drops t binoculars and spins around. He sees...

dialogues.speaker: ...CHICO'S BODY DANGLING ON THE ROPE. CHICO'S HEAD IS BLO
dialogues.text: dead...and won't come back to life. He's been shot throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS stand around dumbly. Those with RIFLES in their quickly sling them onto their shoulders. They're all afra captain's wrath. RHODES walks towards the line of men wit his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Goddammit, somebody's gonna tell me who  fired that shot or I'll have every last one  of you chopped up for feed!!! His eyes spot TOBY, standing behind the crate he dropped rifle slung.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Step up here, Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Sir! TOBY shouts the word like a West Point cadet and he brave forward. RHODES stares him down, his anger turning sinist

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: You fired that shot, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Let me see your weapon. TOBY hands over his rifle. RHODES feels the barrel, sniff

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: It's been fired.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: In the battle, sir. RHODES is sure he's found the guilty man and he's glad it to be his favourite whipping boy. His body relaxes visibl

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: It may be that none of these chicken-shits  will talk while the whole troop is  present...but I know some of these men  well. I'm sure that a few private  conversations will tell me what I already  know. You may have earned yourself some  time in the Stalag, Tyler. (Rhodes glances over at CHICO'S body) Cut him down. That's another head for you  to chop off. Leave it with the others. Take  the rest of his body down to the freezers.  Move it, shit hill. TOBY moves off. RHODES' grin returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's that GIANT SOUND again, the RUMBLE OF THE ELEVATO inside the place called THE CAVE, in a huge under-ground bunker. TECHNICIANS AND ARMED GUARDS bustle around. Enorm hydraulic pistons are bringing the camouflaged iron plate the surface. Riding on board, RHODES AND HIS PLATOON prep unload their paraphernalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, sweating, exhausted, BLEEDING FROM CUTS made by ju branches, wrings out a piece of cloth torn from her sleev dipped it into a jungle stream. Cautiously she tastes the decides to chance it and squeezes the cloth into her mout The NIGHT BIRDS suddenly stop their singing and the quiet look up. Standing across the stream, only ten feet away, PARTICULARLY GROTESQUE ZOMBIE. VULTURES stand on the mars beside the creature's legs, THEIR SHARP BEAKS PICKING BLO ITS ANKLES AND FEET. SARAH jumps to her feet, fighting back exhaustion one mor unslings her RIFLE, aims it, then thinks better of firing up her SUPPLY PACK she runs into the darkening jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! TWO BIG HANDS GRAB SARAH by her shoulders. She star but one of those hands shoots up to cover her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It's alright. It's alright. Don't be  afraid. We're friends. SARAH looks into the strong, good face of JOHN, a tall mu a Caribbean Islander with shiny black skin and enormous b that seem instantly trustworthy.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: There are soldiers near here. Guards. I'll  take my hand away if you won't scream. SARAH nods and JOHN lets her go. There are two other huma behind the big man. There's BILL McDERMOTT, wearing the g covered jump-suit of a mechanic and swilling generous sho from a hip flask, and there's a smallish woman with a sen who, apparently out of character, is armed to the teeth. mute, nicknamed SPIDER, and she is urgently signing "Come get outa here!" with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Right. We better get away from that Bee. He  might have friends. THE GROUP starts moving. SARAH follows voluntarily. We no all three strangers are wearing the same pullover vests t on the foot soldiers, the ones with big orange circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GROUP trudges through thick brushland, occasionally n chop a path with their blades. JOHN speaks in low tones a

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Bees. That's what we call the dead... the  walking dead...here on Gasparilla's island.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Gasparilla?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He was a pirate who sailed these waters  long ago. His name is bein' borrowed these  days by the long lost Henry Dickerson.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Governor Dickerson? Of Florida?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's the man. He's been holed up here  ever since the shit hit the fan. Him and  his family owned these islands 'round here.  They was leasin' this one to the Fed. The  whole underneath is dug out. There was  missiles here and laboratories and bomb  proof housing, nuclear power, all o' that.  Now this is Dickerson's....Gasparilla's...  private fortress. Him and a bunch o' his  cronies from all the best golf courses in  Tallahassee...and his private army, of  course.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We ran up against a platoon of soldiers.  There were actually walking dead...in  uniform...with guns.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Captain Rhodes and his Red Coat Bees. They  could sting, sister. We know you came up  against 'em. We been watchin' you since you  landed. Couldn't help. I'm sorry for that.  We ain't supposed to be outside. If we was  spotted it could....well, it could be the  end of everything. SPIDER is signing for everyone to be quiet. They all stop tracks. BILL McDERMOTT swigs some more brandy. With the s Mohican SPIDER pushes aside the branches of a giant olean peers through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's A HATCHWAY in sight built into A CONCRETE, BUNKER STRUCTURE. FOUR OR FIVE SOLDIERS are coming up out of the They're armed with PRODS AND RIFLES. Behind the men, lurching on unsteady feet, come A HALF-DO LIVING DEAD, all wearing vests of white and blue. Behind the lumbering creatures come A WOMAN AND A MAN bot white laboratory coats and carrying clipboards. The woman HENRIED, one of the top behaviouralists in The Cave. (We' lot more about her later.) THE ZOMBIES are pushing through the undergrowth right in direction of SARAH and her friends. SARAH shows some alar but JOHN calms her with a strong hand. SPIDER has seen the approaching danger. She silently draw SICKLE from her belt. (With her other hand she draws A PI good measure.) BILL McDERMOTT unarmed, nervously takes an swallow from his flask. THE ZOMBIES are getting closer. Too close for comfort. Finally, MARY HENRIED and THE OTHERS turn and disappear i bunker. The last man down pulls the hatch shut. The moment the coast is clear, SPIDER AND JOHN jump up fr THE OTHERS follow their lead. But it's too late. THE ZOMB spotted them. The creatures begin to growl and make AGITA LIKE SOUNDS. SPIDER brings her BLADE up chest-high, ready attack. SARAH lifts her own MACHETE but JOHN reaches over it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Give that to me. Get behind me. Stay behind  me. (SARAH resists, not understanding, somewhat  insulted.) You ain't wearin' a vest. They been taught  not to touch the ones with the circles.  There ain't no hundred percent, all-a-time  rules with the Bees, but most-a-time they  leave us alone. The colour on their vests  tell ya how much schoolin' they got. It's  the ones without colours you gotta watch  out for. SARAH gets behind JOHN, his orange circle acting as her s reaches around with one strong arm and pulls her in tight back. THE ZOMBIES, snarling and showing teeth, move through the ONE shuffles right past SPIDER AND McDERMOTT. It gets stu bramble, changes course and moves on without attacking. ANOTHER ZOMBIE, a "white", trudges within arm's reach of growling all the while. Suddenly it reaches its arms out two angry steps towards the humans who back away. THE ZOMBIES charges. Things happen quickly. JOHN pushes S and swings the MACHETE. THE BLADE SINKS INTO THE CREATURE BLACKENED BLOOD FLIES. An instant later SPIDER'S SICKLE P BESIDE THE BIG KNIFE. THE ZOMBIE twitches for a moment, i rolling, then it falls, lifeless, to the ground. McDERMOTT trots up beside SARAH. He takes a huge swallow flask then offers some to her. She puts the flask to her nothing comes. She holds it out, neck down, to show that McDERMOTT Sorry. Guess I don't know my own strength. JOHN wipes SARAH'S MACHETE on some thick leaves, cleaning the gore, then he returns the weapon to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thanks. I can fight my own battles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I know you can. Like I said, we been  watchin' you. McDERMOTT We better get as far away from here as we  can. We can work the other side of the  island tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (explaining) We found nine entrances to the  Cave so far, and we ain't got the whole  thing near charted yet. That's what we was  doin' out here today. Huntin' for  entrances. McDERMOTT Come on. They find a Bee done like this and  they'll know somebody's been out walkin'  where they shouldn't have been. JOHN bows his head over the downed ZOMBIE. He mumbles sof can't hear the words but we can tell that he's praying, r good words over the corpse of the "white-coat".

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The man I was with...until today...  believed that praying was for blind men who  couldn't see the truth.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: How we gonna break the curse without a  prayer or two.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Curse?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What is it if it ain't a curse?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's a disease. It's a...a bug...a parasite  that infects the brain.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That sounds like a curse to me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We thought we were escaping here. We  thought we'd found an uninhabited island.  Christ! This place is a worse nightmare  than anything I've seen yet!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's true, miss. And that's why  we're doin' what we're doin'. What's  happenin' underground here is just what  Lucifer planned for this sinful race o'  man. But we're gonna beat Lucifer. We're  gonna put an end to what's happenin' here.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh, what did I run into? A bunch o' Jesus  nuts? Religiosos? Prayer won't stop a  bullet from one of those storm troopers and  prayer won't keep one of those monsters  from eatin' your liver for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That's why we didn't use prayers on this  here white coat 'til after he was  destroyed. We ready to fight when we have  to. And we gotta fight now.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look. I BEEN fightin', mister. I been  fightin' for what feels like a hundred  years and I'm finished. I don't need  religion. I don't need prayers. I need a  couple guns and a couple hands. We can sail  on outa here. Find another island where  there ain't so much....traffic.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You think you can find your boat? There's a  thousand little inlets and backwaters all  through here. You remember all the ways you  turned to get where you are now? You leave  yourself a trail? SARAH is stopped by this. She stares at the big man suspi sure whether to believe him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We didn't see the exact spot but we know  about where you landed. But we ain't ready  to take you there. Not yet. You see...we  need guns, too. SARAH looks around her at the unlikely band of guerillas. for a moment...not very long...then she turns and starts jungle.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can find it myself. I didn't come that  far.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Farther than you think. You'll get lost.  You will. And there's Bees all through the  jungle. I ain't lyin' to ya. Religiosos  don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. They just try to hold you for ransom.  Fuck you, Moses! I'm outa here! SARAH plunges into the brush and without so much as a loo her shoulder she disappears. McDERMOTT We can't let her go, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We don't need her guns that bad. Billy boy.  (He's joking.) McDERMOTT The hell we don't! But that's not what I  mean. She'll be dead in ten minutes out  there alone. That or she'll be firin' off  her automatics and wakin' up the troops.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We'll split up. Billy, you go with Spider.  Just an hour or two tonight, that's all.  Rhodes might have extra guards on after all  the commotion. We'll meet up at number six  and go back home together. McDERMOTT God save us. And me with me flask dry. I'll  never make it. THE GROUP splits up, moving off in two different directio the darkening underbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS has fallen. The jungle is as black as the backgr velvet painting. SARAH is moving cautiously. She bumps into something, jum MACHETE high, and freezes. Cautiously she moves ahead...o step...another...another... SPLASH!!! She steps down off a hidden ledge into A KNEE-D She manages to keep her balance but her MACHETE falls int and drops to the bottom invisible in the dark silt. Slowl down and reaches into the water. A SNAKE swims past just SARAH recoils. Before she can reach down again she hears ANIMAL SNORT followed by A GREAT SPLASHING SOUND. Then AN squints to see. SHAPES approach on the black water. ALLIGATORS, big ones, very tops showing as they move on a straight course towar She backs up feeling for the shore, for the ledge behind FIRST ZOMBIE GRABS HER SHOULDERS. She spins and sees the has one eye dangling out of its socket and there's a brok length of wooden pole stuck clean through its torso just left breast. SARAH smashes her RIFLE BUTT INTO THE THING'S HEAD. AGAIN keeps coming. (So do the gators. They're getting to withi yards.) SARAH swings a fourth time. THE ZOMBIE grabs her pulls with all her might and the creature, hanging on to topples off the ledge and into the water. When SARAH starts to climb up on the ledge, ANOTHER ZOMBI towards her from dry land. She spins around, looking for gators are just about close enough to bite her ass and TH that fell into the river is rising up again, covered with slime and looking pissed. SARAH faces THE ZOMBIE on the bank. She has no choice. Sh AUTOMATIC. She's just about to fire when SOMETHING FLASHE darkness. It's A MACHETE. IT CLEAVES OPEN THE ZOMBIE'S SK out of the night big JOHN appears. He struggles to free h from the dead creature's head. SARAH scrambles up onto the muddy ledge. THE GATORS are s in and THE ZOMBIE, its moss-covered arms reaching out rig the arms of Frankenstein's monster, is growling ferocious swallowing its own dangling eyeball in the process).

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you gonna pause to say words over the  dead this time or can we be on our way? Without answering, JOHN steams off through the bush pulli along behind him, his big hand tight around her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on: A TELEVISION SCREEN. First there is only VIDEO an image blinks onto the screen. MONTAGE: OTHER VIDEO SCREENS on MONITORS in various place the huge underground facility. ZOMBIES watch the screens groups of four, six and eight, like children in ranked cl The screens show scenes of ZOMBIES taking FOOD from human CIRCLE VESTS. GUNS are pointed at ORANGE CIRCLES then low harmlessly. GUNS are pointed at HUMANS without orange cir FIRED. The images repeat and repeat and repeat. THE ZOMBI scenes with dumb curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the central area for all varieties of communicati are RADIO CONSOLES, both intercom and outgoing, there are CONTROL PANELS and there are LARGE COMPUTER TERMINALS. Re panic to set up operations back when the disaster first s of the equipment is placed haphazardly and not built in. every which way, BARE ANTENNAS AND LOOSE CONNECTORS clutt place. ENGINEERS scurry with TOOL BOXES constantly repair patching, trouble shooting. Most of the personnel are TECHNICIANS but there is a grou SCIENTIFIC TYPES, obvious in their white lab coats. Among MARY HENRIED, who we caught a glimpse of outside Entrance At A SECURITY STATION, A GUARD notices something on one o VIDEO SCREENS which monitor key locations inside The Cave

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: There's activity in the dormitory! MARY and one of her assistants, JULIE GRANT, a younger gi over to the video console. ONE SCREEN there shows what lo prison corridor. CELLS WITH HEAVILY BARRED DOORS run down We can see the distinct MOVEMENT OF SHADOWS in the corrid reacts instantly stepping over to AN INTERCOM and pressin BUTTON. VOICE (o.s. - filter) Gate twenty-three.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: This is Mary Henried. Did anyone enter the  dormitory? VOICE (o.s. - filter) Yes, ma'm. Captain Rhodes. MARY clicks off, infuriated. She hurries towards AN EXIT JULIE GRANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE MOUTH OF A LARGE PLASTIC BAG. A HAND wearin LEATHER GLOVE pulls A HUMAN HEAD out of a bag by its hair head of one of the dead soldiers from Rhode's platoon. Th belongs to RHODES himself. In the darkness of A CELL, A RED COAT ZOMBIES takes a hes forward. RHODES tries to shove THE HEAD through the bars STICKS. When RHODES lets go it stays there, wedged at sho height.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Take it, friend. Take it. It's a present.  From me to you. THE RED COAT steps forward and lays its hand on THE HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Just remember who gives you favours. THE ZOMBIE pulls hard and THE HEAD pops through onto its bars. The creature lurches off towards A COT in the shado rear of the cell where it hunkers down and begins to RAVI TEARING FLESH OFF, EATING IT hungrily. On the cell door we notice A PLAQUE with a number (5) and marker, the Red Coat's nickname, "BLUTO". RHODES moves past OTHER CELLS, each holding A NICKNAMED R GRUMPY stands way back in the shadows. TONTO stands near growling. FATSO is swaying back and forth like a chubby f who needs to pee. RHODES stops at A CELL marked "BUB!". Inside we see A SIL tall, erect, not moving a muscle. RHODES grins.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Well, Bub. I've heard about you. Miss  Henried's pride and joy. RHODES steps closer and BUB snarls warningly.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Surly sonofabitch. I want to make friends,  Bub. Friends. I have one more goodie in my  sack here. A LOUD, CLANGING SOUND interrupts. RHODES turns to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY HENRIED AND JULIE GRANT have entered through A STEEL ELECTRONIC LOCKS. THE ZOMBIES send up A CHORUS OF MOANS A The women start down the corridor checking cells as they Suddenly they stop in their tracks, their horrified eyes A CELL marked "SAMSON!". SAMSON is nibbling on ANOTHER HEAD. Much of the flesh is gone, but we can still recognise...CHICO. The zombie turn up-side-down, reaches way inside, through the neck, and p grey matter. JULIE backs away, fighting nausea. A spasm rises in MARY' well and she reels away from the hideous sight.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Come, come, Miss Science. You've seen  worse.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: God....damn you, Rhodes!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: God has damned us all. Are my atrocities  worse than yours?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You have ruined weeks of work here! We've  been trying to wean these specimens onto  alligator meat!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: No wonder they're so....hungry. Suddenly JULIE SCREAMS, her hands flying to her mouth. THE PLASTIC BAG is still dangling from RHODES' GLOVED HAN pressed into the thin plastic, we can see the rough outli FINAL HEAD. THE THING IS SQUIRMING causing the whole bag RHODES drops the bag instantly to the floor. Taking care, the bottom by a loose corner and pulls up hard. THE HEAD

dialogues.speaker: ITS MOUTH IS CHEWING, GROTESQUELY, ON THE AIR.
dialogues.text: MARY stares in shock. JULIE runs towards the exit, trying but gagging on her own acids. She's hysterical. RHODES calmly draws his PISTOL, cocks, and FIRES. THE SQU IS SHATTERED by the powerful bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 9 BY 12 CUBICLE with A SMALL COMPUTER TERMINAL, A DESK CHAIRS. There's A LIGHTBOX on the wall displaying GROUPS X-RAYS. MARY guides JULIE GRANT into a chair. RHODES stands cocki open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I didn't realise! Those were de-caps! I  didn't know that....de-caps... revived!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Any dead whose brains are intact will  revive.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: But...we bury the heads. Oh. God! It must  be torture for them!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: They are brutes without feeling. Though I  admit that I've requested cremation for  myself. Burial is an archaic tradition,  even more ridiculous now than it ever was.  To say nothing of the...spacing  problem...on a small island like this.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I thought the purpose of decapitation was  to...to...

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: The purpose of decapitation is to preserve  as much...food...as possible. The purpose  for feeding is to keep the beasts on our  side. The fact that they can be taught to  clean up our garbage or to fire a gun is a  convenient side benefit, not the primary  goal. The primary goal is to keep ourselves  from becoming their supper. Keep them fed  and they behave. Keep them hungry and they  revert back to being the animals that they  have always been. You saw them in there.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You gave them a fresh taste of blood!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: They will never be satisfied with anything  else, Miss Henried. They want human flesh.  I'm prepared to take whatever steps are  necessary to see to it they don't get mine!  Not while I'm still using it! JULIE has calmed herself down. Now she feels angry, betra looks at MARY accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Did you know? About the de-caps?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'd never seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: But you knew. MARY nods in the affirmative. Tears form in JULIE'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What else is there, doctor? What else do  you people know that the rest of us don't? They stare at one another. Whatever bond once existed bet has been severed forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are CARDIOGRAPHS, E.E.G. MONITORS, AND ALL SORT OF CONDITIONING DEVICES. On TABLES lie SYMBOLOGY CARDS AND C BLOCKS for dexterity testing. There are LARGE CUT-OUT SHA walls, TRIANGLES, SQUARES and familiar ORANGE CIRCLES. MARY storms into the room flinging the door shut behind h catches it with his BLACK LEATHER GESTAPO BOOT.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: You can't run away from the planet, Miss  Science. You can't even run away from the  island, heh heh.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, you...COCKSUCKER!!! RHODES laughs loudly. MARY faces him, hatred boiling away vocabulary. She can't think of word that are adequate.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You're....you're disgusting!  You're....FILTH!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: And you're the one who builds the bomb and  they says, 'I hope it'll never actually be  used'. MARY is stopped...by her own guilt. She turns and busies gathering books and papers, then she CLICKS OFF A LIGHT a toward the doorway where RHODES stands.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (calmer, with method) Julie Grant is a  behaviouralist. She's not medical. She  hasn't been as...exposed to...to  things...as some of the rest of us. She'll  be alright. I'll talk to her. She'll be  alright.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Oh, I have no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (recognising threat in his voice) If you  put her on the shit list because of her  reaction here tonight I'll go to Dickerson.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, our noble Gasparilla does seem to  favour you lately. I understand he assigned  you a roommate of your choice. The rest of  us have to pick names out of a hat.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (reading his jealousy) Rhodes, you and I  had a roll in the hay together when I first  got here. It was a wholly unsatisfying  experience which I do not want to, and  which I never will repeat! So give up,  mister! I'm going home...to that roommate  you mentioned. MARY pushes past RHODES into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY starts down the hall but RHODES grabs her from behin in close, lusting, pressing his lips against the back of

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me! Right now! An evil grin returns to RHODES' flushed face. He stares a for a long moment, then he lets go. MARY walks away, bris RHODES calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Maybe you'll change your mind when it  starts getting too lonely for you. MARY stops dead. She turns back to see him gloating.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I'm not entirely without influence myself,  Miss Science. I had your roommate  assigned...by Gasparilla... to my platoon.  What's his name? Tyler? Yes. Toby Tyler. A bubble of fear pushes up in MARY'S throat but she is on her anger show. Her stare is fierce, her eyes daggers.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I had an unfortunate little run-in with him  today. In fact...you might say that Mr.  Tyler is in big trouble with  the...authorities.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You better not mess with me, Rhodes. I'd  love to serve your balls to those Red Coats  for lunch! Think about it!

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: No, Miss Science. You're the one who needs  to do some thinking. He turns and walks away. MARY stands still for a time, TH RHODES' CLICKING BOOTHEELS surrounding her, swallowing he DEEP BACKGROUND we can HEAR THE MOANS OF THE CAGED DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: as MARY walks through HUGE OPEN AREAS CARVED OUT ROCK. We are stunned at the enormity of the place. JEEPS RUMBLE back and forth. Storage areas hold MOUNTAINS OF CR CARTONS, WATER AND GAS CANISTERS. FORK LIFTS shift loads there. MARY comes to a place where the natural rock surrenders t walls. She enters past TWO SECURITY GUARDS, showing her I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY moves down A CORRIDOR with NUMBERED DOORS on both si

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF LIFE, MUSIC BLASTING, VOICES LAUGHING, ARGUI
dialogues.text: PEOPLE move by. A MAN AND A WOMAN are fighting. She slaps punches her, she kicks him in the balls. THREE HOOKERS po door. The door is opened by A NAKED MAN WEARING A DILDO o OTHER MEN, behind him, laugh wildly as the hookers enter filled room. MARY stops in her tracks when she sees that outside A DOO 83 (the door to her quarters) there are TWO OF RHODES' SO RIFLES in hand. The door itself is open and SHADOWS move MARY turns quickly, before she is spotted, and starts bac the hallway. As she turns a corner she is grabbed by TOBY

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Toby...thank God...wait here. I gotta find  out what's goin' on.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Hey. Slow down. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Some of Rhodes' men. At the door.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: That bastard. I didn't think he'd make his  move so fast.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's because of me.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Oh, bullshit, Mary. It's because Rhodes is  a prick.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I want you to leave. Then maybe...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: We're both gonna leave. Leave the island.  I've been talkin' to Tricks. We think we  can smuggle out one of those inflatable  rafts. They're crated up real small.  They've got air canisters. There's food  inside. Even a little motor.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I am not...a guerilla fighter, Toby. I'm  not a pioneer. I'm not...I'm not strong  that way. I need...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Need what? Civilised order like we have  down here? Christ!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I can work here. Maybe my work can  help...help everyone. I can do more good  with access to this equipment than I can  off in some wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: For the good of mankind. That's what every  monster-maker says. MARY looks into TOBY'S eyes. She's hurt, yet angry. The k that comes involuntarily when somebody strikes an already guilt-nerve.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: We're gettin' out. Me and Tricks. I want  you to come with us. I want that more than  anything. I'll send word. I'll let you know  a time and a place to meet. We probably  won't be able to wait around so if you're  not there on the dot...well...if you're not  there, I'll know you're not comin'. She grabs him, holding him tightly against her. They kiss long. TOBY pulls away, looks at her lovingly, then turns toward the guarded apartment. MARY follows.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: (walking) I don't know what they're gonna  do to me. I figure they'll just send me out  to Stalag Seventeen but if...if it's worse  than that...Tricks will know. Stay in touch  with Tricks. As they approach the door to number 83, THE SOLDIERS ther their RIFLE to ready positions.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. I'll take your weapon. TOBY hands over his RIFLE and begins to unbuckle his PIST MORE SOLDIERS appear from inside the open apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: What's he supposed to have done? What are  the charges?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Dunno, ma'm. We're on orders.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look...I'm Mary Henried. I'm with the  special conditioning center. I'm not  without influence...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: (calmly) Mary.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'll have somebody's ass for this. I'll  have your ass, soldier. I'm not gonna stand  here and...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: (more insistent) MARY! She gives up. She looks into TOBY'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: I'll be alright. Just remember the things I  said. Take care of yourself. THE SOLDIERS escort TOBY down the hall without force. MAR their backs for a time, then she flings her BOOKS AND PAP into the open apartment. She begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HATCHWAY NUMBER SIX is surrounded by PROTECTIVE FENCING a A FENCED ALLEYWAY runs off through the brush toward...we what yet. THE HATCH OPENS and TOBY, along with TWO OTHER PRISONERS, disarmed troopers, is led down that alleyway by THREE GUA JOHN, SARAH AND BILL McDERMOTT peer out from nearby folia watch the procession. John whispers.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The fences make a safe pathway to Stalag  Seventeen. That's where we live. That's  where you gonna live, too. Hell's half  acre. It's not a nice place. Them boys  there is prisoners. What's their  punishment? They sent out to the Stalag for  a few weeks. That's punishment enough. SPIDER seems to appear from nowhere. She motions and the follow her through the thick jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RUNNING FENCE LEADS TO A GATE IN A BIGGER FENCE. This ELECTRIFIED. We know this because we see A COLLECTION OF mostly "civilians" with no vests, clambering there, HANDS SPARKING WHEN THEY TOUCH THE CHAIN LINKS. THE ZOMBIES send up wild MOANS AND GURGLES when TOBY AND PRISONERS are led through the gate. Inside the compound is A SCATTERING OF OPEN-SIDED MILITAR BUILDINGS, resembling those on M*A*S*H. There's A DIN com place, a mixture of MUSIC AND VOICES that forms a disturb of noise. The place seems to seethe like a hornets' next. THE SOLDIERS head back for The Cave as POSTED GUARDS shut behind THE PRISONERS. TOBY and the other captives move to "village".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE wallow in the mud. ONE MAN has just taken a shit a his ass. Nearby A DRUNK lies unconscious. SEVERAL MEN are It's a brutal fight with BOTTLES AND PIPES AND LENGTHS OF men are really hurting each other. PEOPLE SMOKE AND SNORT UP in wide open disarray. A HUGE PREGNANT WOMAN plants herself right in TOBY'S path

dialogues.speaker: PREGNANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: How 'bout it, baby. I'm big but I'm  beautiful. TOBY pushes past her and bumps into A SURLY DRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: HEY, YOU FUCK
dialogues.text: He grabs TOBY and flings him violently against an upright the long huts. THE OTHER TWO PRISONERS move on, abandonin disappearing into the crowd. THE DRUNK pulls A RUSTED, HO KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND...LIKE...
dialogues.text: Suddenly VOMIT rises in the man's throat and he doubles o aware of SOUNDS behind him. At his back, in the hut, A HA still wearing his boxer shorts and his muddy boots, is wh bamming A WHORE, who is wearing everything but underwear There are needle tracks on the woman's arms and her face though she's been beaten brutally. She purses her deep re lips and blows TOBY a kiss that's meant to be seductive. TOBY moves on down the street. We live in our  own filth, with bugs and snakes and disease  and jungle fever...all the time waitin' to  become breakfast for the Bees. JOHN is doing a sales job on SARAH but everything he says She hears it all, softening to JOHN'S cause. SPIDER has silently lifted A LARGE WOODEN ROUND out of th It's a camouflaged tunnel entrance.

dialogues.text: Who are you? Who are you? He stands up too quickly. Dizziness makes him reel. He sm AN INSTRUMENT CART, comes up with A LONG-BLADED SCALPEL a thing threateningly aimed at the stranger.

SPIDER snatches THE PACK away rather roughly. SARAH is a disturbed by the action. THE MATERIAL is stashed under FL beside the tunnel entrance.

BILL McDERMOTT pulls out his empty flask. McDERMOTT Doc, I need a fill up. I'll help m'self if  it's alright with you. McDERMOTT pockets the refilled flask, takes a long slug f cabinet bottle before putting it back, and moves out of t LOGAN is left alone with DIESEL AND SPIDER.

The folks you met...me and them and a  couple others is the whole rebel army.  Nobody else gives a shit...and they're  afraid o' Rhodes. A FIGHT spills out onto the muddy stree selling all sort of delights accost JOHN and his group.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You disappear in here, darlin'. You get a  knife in yer belly or too much shit in yer  veins. You get lost out here and nobody's  gonna notice. Rhodes, he counts on that. It  all makes for food in the freezers. They come to A LONG HUT WITH A SIGN that reads: THE RITZ.

dialogues.text: This is your hotel. I'm not gonna stay here  with you but I'll always be close. You  gonna hafta take care o' yourself like you  said you was able to do. SARAH nods. JOHN smiles at her. His warm, trustworthy eye glow in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Some may notice that you're new. Just deny  it. You'll get away with it. Nobody really  looks at each other around here. Go on in.  Get some sleep. He squeezes her hand tightly, then he turns away and move McDERMOTT. SARAH moves into THE RITZ.
