dialogues.text: It resembles the hospital. There are ROWS AND ROWS OF COT PEOPLE SLEEP, alone and in pairs. OTHERS are awake, drink screwing, shooting up. SARAH finds an empty cot and flops Beyond the open walls she can see THE BLUE-WHITE FLASHES the electrified fence. RAIN LEAKS in on her but it doesn' from falling asleep.

dialogues.text: TECHNICIANS are working with ZOMBIES while ARMED GUARDS s We FOCUS ON A BLUE COAT. Under supervision, the thing is tie a shoelace. It's failing miserably but trying hard. A is busy placing LITTLE WOODEN SHAPES into their proper HO BOARD. TWO RED COATS sit at a table attended by HUMAN TECHNICIAN seen these zombies before, in the dormitory. The other RED COAT, BLUTO, looks just like Bluto from Pop with a thick, black beard. Tired of THE JIG SAW PUZZLE he on, he snarls and suddenly lunges for the meat on TONTO'S snatches a handful and stuffs it in his mouth. As soon as it, however, he pulls it back out, dribbling and spitting disgustedly. FISHER (a technician) They won't accept a substitute. They want  their Alpo. TONTO has succeeded in forking a piece of meat. He moves mouth and pops it in.

dialogues.text: Alright! Way ta go, Kemosabe! MARY HENRIED has entered the room. She pulls up and watch with a kind of dubious interest. TONTO stops chewing. He with exaggerated sadness on his face. Slowly his mouth op chewed piece of meat slides out between his lips. He thro down angrily.

dialogues.text: They won't learn to use forks if they don't  like the breakfast you're serving, Ted.

dialogues.text: The fork is like a game to them. If they  get into the game maybe they'll learn to  like the food.

dialogues.text: It won't work. Suddenly BLUTO jumps up from the table. He flings his cha tromps right over to MARY. His arms are outstretched and a pleading, Karloff-like SOUND. GUARDS come after him but them off.

dialogues.text: It's alright! Leave him alone! MARY extends her right hand to meet BLUTO'S right and the vigorously. Then the dumb creature drops his arms and loo His brain sends no signal as to what he should do next. T lead him away.

CLOSE ON: A TARGET, a flat, cut out silhouette of a man, TRIANGLES painted on the instant-kill-zones, brain, heart STRIKE the neck, the to torso, SOME RICOCHET off the wall None hit the kill-zones. THE NOISE is deaf TECHNICIANS are watching the shooters and keeping score. up to one of them.

BUB slaps leather...fast... lighting GUN come up. BLAM-KA-BLAM-KA-BLAM-BLAM-BLAM-BLAM!!! HOLES APPEARS IN THE TARGET...WOP-WOPPETY-WHUMP!!! All in zones, or damn close. BUB slaps ONE PISTOL back into its HOLSTER. He clicks ope chamber on THE OTHER, dumps the SPENT CARTRIDGES and begi from his belt. MARY stares at the creature's back, mixed emotions showin face. There are TWO WOMEN cleaning the locker room with MOPS AN of them turns to watch MARY HENRIED exit. We recognise he SPIDER.

Now they sit in council, "ye everything the boss man says. A STATE PROSECUTOR has a DESPERATE-LOOKING PRISONER on th standing with his hands cuffed.

He's  charged with the theft of that equipment  from a government installation and with  possession of an illegal radio. GASPARILLA munches on SOME FRUIT. He's a fat man with a h moustache that makes him look like Pancho Villa. As an in rank we wears a military jacket but underneath is a Hawai with a bold flamingo and palm tree pattern. Around his ne in the rolls of fat there, is enough gold to stake a smal

dialogues.text: I can only suggest that the court rule in  favour of the ultimate penalty for this  traitor.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: You always recommend the ultimate penalty,  Tommy Lee. You and Rhodes. We now see that RHODES is present, looking on with a smil

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: All those...AGAINST...the ultimate penalty  raise yer hands. None of THE COUNCILMEN move a muscle. GASPARILLA scans th he takes a big, wet bite out of a peach.

dialogues.text: Ya mean ta say nobody's gonna object to the  ultimate penalty in this here case? Well,  what if I object? What if I object to the  ultimate penalty. THE COUNCILMEN look nervous, apprehensive. GASPARILLA'S f power-muscles.

dialogues.text: There's been a whole lotta swingin'  influence and swingin' weight arountyere  lately. Does anybody at all give two shits  fer what I think any more? Well, I'm a- gonna let this guy off. How d'yall like  that? And I want the word ta git out I let  'im off. I let 'im off. Not this council.  Maybe I can improve my image rountyere. THE PRISONER looks up at GASPARILLA, hatred boiling insid GASPARILLA meets his gaze with a power-mad sneer.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Yer sentenced ta hard labour. Stalag  Seventeen. A year.

dialogues.speaker: PIG
dialogues.text: GUARDS drag the screaming PRISONER from the room. GASPARI back in his chair, flustered but unscarred. His skin is a thick. He pitches the peach and grabs up a mango. MARY HE the chamber and rushes toward an empty chair. GASPARILLA DOCKET on his desk, smiles, and looks up at MARY.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Well, Miss Henried, what a coincidence.  You're just in time fer a case that seems  ta concern you. Guess you didn't care about  the other proceedin's we been dealin' with  here this mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was...busy. In the lab.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Well, you managed ta make it here jus' in  time fer this case, didn't ya? RHODES replaces THE PROSECUTOR on the floor. He smiles at pointedly as he starts his speech.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Sir. In the matter of the State versus  Private Tyler, I don't want to...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (standing) Sir, Tyler is innocent of any  crime against the State. Captain Rhodes  is...

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: (with a mouthful of mango) Miss Henried, I  think you better...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: ...Captain Rhodes is trying to...

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: (spitting a wad of chewed pulp into his  hand) MISS HENRIED, SHUT THE HELL UP!!! MARY'S eyes indicate her frustration and anger but she do GASPARILLA plops the handful of fruit pulp onto the floor fingers on his military jacket.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: I don't want to take up a lot of time with  this. Mr Tyler shot a prisoner against  orders. There are eyewitnesses. I've  reprimanded Tyler and I've had him sent  outside. It's as simple as that.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Ya had 'im sent ta the Stalag? That's all  ya did to 'im?

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: The prisoner was dying, sir. Tyler acted  out of a sense of mercy. I don't believe  Tyler to be dangerous, General. He just  needs...discipline. Two or three months  outside will teach him...discipline.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Sir. It's quite clear that...

dialogues.speaker: SIDDOWN AN' SHUT THE HELL UP
dialogues.text: MARY checks herself. There's a perverse air of danger fum fat General. His attitude toward MARY has clearly changed been working on him. MARY seems to have lost this round. hope that's all she's going to lose.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Now I think Captain's punishment is fair,  considerin'. In fact I think you ain't got  shit ta complain about.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (softly, carefully) I'm sorry, General, if  I...spoke out of turn. It's just that...Mr  Tyler is not here to defend himself. He has  no representation. I don't believe due  process is being served by...

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Listen, Missy. I am the only due process  that has ta be served aroun' tyere and one  of the people doin' the servin' from now on  is gonna be you. Now you been prancin'  aroun' the Cave like yer ass was glass fer  long enough! All that's

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: gonna change, young lady. Now if you still  got a statement you'd like ta make, you can  jus' hold onto it 'til tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: That's right. 'Bout eight, if that suits.  We'll start out in my gymnasium an'  progress on from there...to various other  forms o' physical therapy. MARY shoots a hate-filled eye full at RHODES. THE CAPTAIN with a phoney look of sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is full of EXERCISE EQUIPMENT, TREADMILLS, WEIG NAUTILUS, ETC. There are other items which seem contradic PILLOWS, A HUGE CIRCULAR BED SURROUNDED BY MIRRORS. Delic FOOD AND DRINK lie about on LOW TABLES. The room is a cro Elaine Powers and a harem chamber. A HUGE COFFIN-SHAPED DEVICE opens and we see that the ins with ULTRAVIOLET TUBES which are covered with plexiglass. lounges inside the thing, sweating, having just taken a l fake sunshine. All around are THE COUNCILMEN, some with COUNTRY-CLUB TYP conservatively dressed and wearing suitable jewellery (ob wives left over from the good old days), and some with SC COURTESANS. OTHER SCANTILY CLAD "BUNNY" TYPES are serving HORS-D'OEUV pouring WINE, offering SMOKE AND SNORT. MARY HENRIED is sitting on the floor, lost in fluffy pill COAT incongruous. RHODES watches her from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: WITH IT...HA HA HA...
dialogues.text: MUSIC BLARES and SEVERAL OF THE COURTESANS spring up, str what few clothes they are wearing. Some strip naked, othe panties. They hop onto various exercise machines and begi "workout", tits flopping, thighs pumping...GASPARILLA'S k entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Oh, Lordy, Lordy...I'm drunk as a skunk.  Look at this...will ya jus' loooooook at  these lovelies! Say, Henried, you ever try  it with another woman? MARY looks up at the General, not knowing whether or not answer, afraid of what he might try to make her do.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: I've tried it with boys. Too strenuous. FOUR MORE WOMEN have brought in SILVER PLATTERS full of N D'OEUVRES, prepared carefully and laid them out like sush distributed and people eat them

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Folks...I just couldn't resist. How d'yall  like those? How do those taste? GUESTS look up, not knowing what to expect. MARY fears th looks around to see RHODES grinning. A knot comes up into She tries to swallow it down.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Fresh from the freezers, folks. It's  what...THEY...EAT! A FEW OF THE GUESTS are revulsed. ONE MAN starts to vomit from the room.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Just kiddin' folks. Just kiddin'. Would I  do a thing like that? I ask ya now, would  I? Hah ha ha ha ha... Relief spreads and the bacchanalian atmosphere restores i GASPARILLA spills himself out of the tanning coffin and f some pillows near MARY. He grabs up a goblet and swills r which runs down his front.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: The great state of Florida. People came  here fer years ta die. Retire and expire.  The rest o' the country used ta think we  was nothin' but a bunch o' farts and  fogies. Hah! Now this here's the new  Capital o' the World! Hah! They came  here...died...went to hell...and the Devil  sent 'em back as an army. Hah! General  Gasparilla's army...MY ARMY!

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: We think there are other cities surviving.  We think maybe Detroit... there's some  signalling out of Philly.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: There's no place like this place. Warm  climate. This facility. Christ, there ain't  nothin' like this no-damn-where! Even the  Feds knew that. That's why they stored so  much o' their shit down here. It's all mine  now. All mine. Just let 'em try ta come  after us down here, which they will some  day...take a likin' ta what all we got an'  come after us. They'll hafta get past my  army! An army that ain't afraid ta die...ha  ha ha...'cause it's awreddy DAID! HA HA HA  HA....

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: It's not a very big army. And small as it  is you won't be able to continue feeding it  for very long. We've got to find ways of  getting them to respond without relying  on...

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: You'll find the ways, Miss Mary. And when  ya do...we'll sail on over to the  mainland...or any other damn mainland fer  that matter...and start us a recruitin'  program. There's millions o' Bees out there  jus' waitin' fer' a General ta lead 'em on  ta vict'ry! GASPARILLA swallows another huge quantity of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty now. Remnants of food and drink clutter THE FAT GENERAL is asleep, snoring loudly, one of his pud draped across MARY HENRIED'S lap. She is trying to move o under without waking the man. She slides on the floor...a inches...a few inches more. GASPARILLA snorts and rolls o eyes pop open, focus on MARY, and a smile pushes his fat

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Well, hi there, y'all. Mary looks down at the man, repulsed and afraid. Suddenly her LAB COAT. She pulls away and he crawls after her, his bouncing along the floor. BUTTONS POP and the coat falls reaches for her blouse. It tears away and for a moment he chubby handful of bare breast. He dives into her but he's before his face reaches her chest. MARY pulls herself out from under his dead weight. Shiver clutches her blouse together and hurries out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light is just breaking through the trees when THE GATES A admitting FIVE UNIFORMED MEN into the compound. Outside t ZOMBIES clamber excitedly as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH jumps, awakened by A VOICE AND THE LOUD POUNDING OF against the upright of the sleeping hut.

dialogues.speaker: REVEILLE
dialogues.text: RHODES is standing near the entrance. FOUR SOLDIERS are d pounding. Stunned, disease-ridden faces look up as CITIZE awakened from sleep. Fear sweeps through the place like a wind.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: We found two white Bees in the jungle with  their heads chopped open. I want to know  who's going outside the compound. I want to  know how they're going out. I want to know  why they're going out. Until I get these  answers...each morning...some of you will  die. Without warning RHODES draws his MAGNUM and...BLAM! BLAM! TWO COT PEOPLE who happen to be at close range. They tumb dirt floor, dead before they hit. RHODES scans the rest of the hut. He spots a familiar fac PRISONER from the Council Room, the one Gasparilla saved sentence. The man makes the sign of the cross, knowing wh BLAM! BLAM! RHODES FIRES TWO RAPID ROUNDS and THE PRISONE TURNS RED. He flies off his cot into one adjacent, landin a SCREAMING WOMAN. RHODES AND HIS MEN leave as abruptly as they entered. SAR stunned. As PEOPLE around her react with sobs and more sc locks her eyes on RHODES. He is moving authoritatively down the street just outside walled structure. He passes within inches of SARAH'S cot right against the outside rail. Her emotions well up insi is about to jump out into the street when A BIG BLACK HAN arm. It's JOHN, who has pushed through the gathering crow

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let me go! I'm the one he wants. This is  all happening because of me. If I turn  myself in...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: He's just finding another reason for  bumpin' us off. Don't ya see. He needs us  ta die. He needs our bodies.  Behind JOHN on the street TOBY TYLER is looking on. He ha conversation. JOHN turns and sees him. His eyes go dark w apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: It's alright. I'm a friend. I need help and  so do you. What's a safe place to talk?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Ain't no place safe.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Look...I know you have no reason to trust  me. I've got friends in the Cave. I got  some stuff comin' out this mornin'. I'm  gonna try to get off the island. PEOPLE are pushing in closer attracted by the commotion i Ritz. TOBY has to make it fast. He whispers.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have this stuff sent over to the  hospital...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The hospital? (surprised, worried)

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. My stuff's all marked with red  crosses so nobody gets too nosey. Meet me  at the hospital after the supplies come in.  Maybe we can find a place there to talk.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Maybe. TOBY drifts off into the crowd. JOHN AND SARAH exchange g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPPLIES are being brought in through THE MAIN GATES, CRA CARTONS, BAGS OF GRAIN, SEED, FERTILISER. TRICKS is in charge of the patrol from the Cave. He's che as they're picked up by WORKERS from the compound. TOBY T up to his friend.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Hey, Tricks. Some detail they got you on.

dialogues.speaker: TRICKS
dialogues.text: Not as bad as yours, pal.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: (whispering) What'dya get?

dialogues.speaker: TRICKS
dialogues.text: Rafts. Two 38s. A little ammo.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: We need fuel, and a couple automatics. LUKEY, the orderly, picks up A DOLLY which is LOADED DOWN MARKED WITH RED CROSSES.

dialogues.speaker: TRICKS
dialogues.text: Hey, you. Those two on the bottom. Don't  open those yet. They might be from the  wrong shipment. Just keep 'em around 'til I  can check.

dialogues.speaker: LUKEY
dialogues.text: Yessir. I never open 'em. Nossir. I keep  'em innaback for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from the shadows of A BUILDING are JOHN, SARAH A

dialogues.speaker: DIESEL
dialogues.text: He's a spy. A spy for Rhodes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Give him a chance. They see TOBY pull away from TRICKS and start down the st following LUKEY. They move out and catch up with TOBY, fl

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What'dya tell that soldier, soldier? You  tell him we was rebels?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: He's my contact for Chrissake! There's two  crates. Can you get me into the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREAK! A CROWBAR pries open A CRATE. JOHN AND LUKEY guard entrance while TOBY AND DIESEL work at opening the "Red C SARAH stands nearby. THE LIDS LIFT and we see TWO ARMY-IS RAFTS.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: There ya go. Complete with air  canisters...little motors.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We got a boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I say we got a boat. Can you get other  stuff?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: I got some fuel comin' out and, I hope,  some automatic rifles.

dialogues.speaker: DIESEL
dialogues.text: He's just tryin' to win us over. This  doesn't prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna trust him, Diesel. He already  knows who we are and we ain't got a bunch  o' time to mess around with Rhodes shootin'  up the joint every mornin'. TOBY, rooting through the open crates, finds THE PISTOLS him about and A FEW BOXES OF AMMO. He tosses one of the g The big man walks over and puts the weapon back inside th

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Can't walk around here with these. Let's  just leave 'em here 'til we ready ta use  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: HANDS carefully...very carefully...pouring DROP LIQUID INTO A TEST TUBE. The liquid is sweating slowly ou MILDEWED AND ROTTING STICK OF DYNAMITE which has been sof near-melting by jungle heat. A DOZEN TEST TUBES stand in a rack, already filled. SPIDE woman, SALLY, and a man, JACK, each have their own DYNAMI Each is transferring LIQUID SWEAT...which is, of course, glycerine...into A GLASS TUBE. They work in tense silence operating table. DOC LOGAN works with them, doing the same delicate proced Suddenly his hands starts to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Take it away from me. Quickly. Take it!  Take it! SPIDER reaches over and, as gently as possible, takes the THE DYNAMITE out of the doctor's hands. She sets the tube and returns the dynamite to AN OPEN CRATE, years old and mildew and mud, still half-filled with sticks yet to be d danger passed, they all breathe a sigh of relief. LOGAN w river of sweat from his face. His hands are shaking quite now. He pops pills, dry, from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm sorry. I'll, er...I'll be  alright...in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're sick, Doc. You been sick for a while  now. Too sick to be workin' with us on this  raid. JOHN, SARAH AND DIESEL are standing in a corner of the ro TYLER is with them, sweating and obviously nervous.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You've helped us enough, providin' cover,  hidin' us out. Let the rest of us handle  the physical stuff. It's too much for you.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: It's my fight as much as yours. The things  they made me do...the things they  made...me...do. I want so see Rhodes  destroyed. I want to see all of them, all  of them destroyed. It's my duty...in the  eyes of God. In the eyes of God. LOGAN is really flipso now, over the edge into banana-lan

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: It won't work. That's pure nitro you're  dealin' with there. That stuff can blow if  you look at is funny. What're you gonna do,  walk into the Cave carryin' those tubes on  feather pillows? You don't have a complete  layout of the place. Even if you manage to  avoid a fight you won't know where to go.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We're hopin' you can show us where ta go,  Toby.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I'm tryin' to get off this island  alive. I'll help you all I can but I'm not  goin' in there on a suicide mission. What  can you hope to accomplish? Some radios  maybe? A supply room or two? You'll all be  killed and in a few weeks they'll be back  to business as usual. That place was built  to withstand nuclear attack! What are you  gonna do with a half-dozen guns and a few  sticks of nitro?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We're gonna blow up the powder magazine.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We know what's down there. We did the  loading' and unloadin' when the stuff came  ashore in the early days. A direct hit  oughta do more than a few weeks worth o'  damage.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: A direct hit'll blow the top off this whole  island! How're you gonna fuse the stuff?  How're you gonna leave yourself time to get  out?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: If we don't get out it's a small price to  pay.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' out of your minds! There's  two hundred people down there. You gonna  murder two hundred people?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Sinners! Animals! Filth! Doing the work of  the Devil!

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: What about the people here in the camp? If  they don't get blown to kingdom come their  food'll be destroyed, their water, medical  supplies. They won't have any more power.  This island can't support them all, they'll  be doomed. Count me out, friends. I'm gonna  get my ass outa here. Anybody wants to come  along is welcome. Silence falls over the room. Finally JOHN moves towards t TOBY follows but before exiting he turns back to face the more.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: I wanna see Rhodes burn just a much as you  do...but all those people. We don't have  the right to be their judges... just like  they don't have the right to be our judges. JOHN opens the door and TOBY exits. SARAH follows. JOHN l at the faces in the group, then he leaves, shutting the d him. There's a long silence, then LOGAN speaks.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: We know what we must do. It's written for  us in the Bible. "They shall be driven from  the land of the living down to the world of  the dead. That is the fate of those who  care nothing for God."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUKEY stands guard. McDERMOTT has joined SARAH AND JOHN i huddle. TOBY stands nearby, feeling strangely guilty.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Toby's right. They're not gonna sit around  with their fingers up their asses while we  bust up their toys.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Datura.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Datura Metel. The Devil's Trumpet. Don't  worry. I ain't goin' religioso again. It's  a flower that grows on these islands. Where  I come from the voodoo priests used it  whenever they needed a Mickey Finn. It's  toxic. Ground up you can put it in a drink  or inject it...or...in a sealed area it  might be introduced through the ventilation  system.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Datura! Miguel knew it! Datura, he was  shouting! Datura Metel!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We always planned to use it. We got some  ground up already...but we could never find  enough.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There's hundreds of 'em. Right where we  landed our boat.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: This stuff really works? No shit?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Quicker than gas. And it smells a lot  prettier. It usually don't kill but it puts  ya under fer a good night's sleep.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: If you could knock out the central  communications room you could foul up their  whole intercom system. Then, if you move  fast enough, stay ahead of 'em...without  bein' able to signal each other, they might  have a hard time catchin' you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I say it's poetic. Pure calypso, brother.  The Devil's Trumpet blowin' the notes o'  doom for the Devil's troops. Ha ha ha ha  ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FISHING BOAT that bought SARAH and her friends to the still in the channel. There are SOLDIERS ABOARD, two of R pacing the deck, passing a bottle back and forth. JOHN (o.s.) Well, we found yer boat, lady, but so did  they. JOHN, SARAH AND TOBY are huddled behind green cover peeri the boat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Looks like just two. We can take 'em when  the time comes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We're only about a quarter-mile from Cave  entrance number five.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: That entrance is closest to the labs and  the Bee cages.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go. They move off stealthily. They enter the clearing with the spectacular PLANTS that discovered. Six feet tall, their red-gold blossoms like t their bells down, these are Daturas, nightshades indigeno southern Florida and parts of the Caribbean. SALLY AND JACK, who we saw working on the nitro sticks, a off the eighteen-inch blossom and stuffing them into LARG They're wearing HOSPITAL MASKS over their mouth and noses in to help. TOBY AND SARAH follow but JOHN stops them.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Just stand guard for now. Spell us after a  while. Can't breathe this grass too long or  somebody hafta carry you home. Work goes on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC ROCKS AND VOICES SHOUT. The street scene is as wild HOOKERS, PUSHERS AND DRUNKS pack the hot darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At A COT near the open wall, in DIM LIGHT FROM AN OVERHEA OUTSIDE, SARAH, JOHN AND TOBY huddle. The DIN from the st it impossible for others to hear them. TOBY is drawing A

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Maintenance shafts run behind all the main  rooms. Nobody's in those at night. You can  use them to get around in. Hit the power  governors first. Kick a surge into their  computer network and you erase everything  stored in the memory. Then...over in  here...that's where the cages are... On the street outside, a puffing BILL McDERMOTT pushes th unruly crowd, his face showing alarm. McDERMOTT The Doc's gone. Diesel and Jack and Spider  with him. They took the guns... and the  nitro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: LUKEY, beside himself, almost to the point of t

dialogues.speaker: LUKEY
dialogues.text: I coulden stop 'em, boss. No way I coulda  stop 'em, I sweah. They tie me up and stick  dis... (He's waving a pillowcase in his hand, the  action accentuating his frenzied state.) ...they stick dis in my mouf. You b'lieve  dis? JOHN is in the room with SARAH, TOBY, SALLY AND BILL McDE is now the entire rebel force. THE FLOORBOARDS TO THE TUN been thrown aside. The weapons are gone. McDERMOTT I was in the Cave yesterday workin'  repairs. Spider was in on clean up. I seen  her talkin' ta some insiders... well, she  was scribblin', they was talkin'...mighty  palsy.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Jesus! They're gonna try to do it! They're  goin' in! They got somebody to help 'em  from the inside!

dialogues.speaker: LUKEY
dialogues.text: They din' get da pistols. You know dem  pistols you buddy send in widda raffs.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: I gotta get Mary out. Tricks. We gotta go  now! Tonight! Right away! McDERMOTT Oh, Lord! (He polishes of what's left in  his flask and moves to refill it from the  bottles in Logan's cabinet.)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: We're not ready.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well...if ya think about it...we as ready  as we ever gonna be. How was they carryin'  the nitro, Lukey?

dialogues.speaker: LUKEY
dialogues.text: Oh, me. You ain't gonna b'lieve dis,  neider. You ain't, I sweah. They put it  inta Spidah's body.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: They what?

dialogues.speaker: LUKEY
dialogues.text: De Doc. He cut up Spidah here and here and  here...all ovah. He stick dem tubes in  dere, like undah da skin...an' den he sews  'em all up. I sweah. I sweah, sweah, sweah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK AND DIESEL are chopping a path through the undergrow MACHETES. Behind them DOC LOGAN is walking slowly along w guiding her carefully around obstacles. SPIDER is in majo She's sweating rivers, her fists are clenched, she's biti lip so that it bleeds.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I know it hurts. But it won't be long. Then  all the pain will be over. Oh, I wish you  could hear me. GOD, GIVE HER THE EARS TO

dialogues.speaker: DIESEL
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Quiet. Yes. We must be quiet. Suddenly, A ZOMBIE lunges from the underbrush, its FACE B DETERIORATED and one of its hands; lost during its human replaced by A MECHANICAL HOOK. SPIDER stumbles. She holds and stiffens all her muscles. Miraculously the nitro vial do not explode. LOGAN throws himself quixotically in fron ZOMBIE.

dialogues.speaker: THWOK
dialogues.text: CHEST. The man's eyes reflect no immediate sensation. His falters but only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: PAIN...
dialogues.text: THE ZOMBIE pulls LOGAN towards its DROOLING, WIDE OPEN MO just about to bite when DIESEL CHOPS HIS MACHETE INTO THE THE CREATURE'S SKULL. The thing falls, pulling LOGAN, sti to the ground with it.

dialogues.speaker: THE PAIN OF HELL.
dialogues.text: DIESEL frees the doctor's shoulder from the hook. BLOOD F DIESEL grabs a handful of DRESSINGS from LOGAN'S PACK and work on the wound.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: ...the pain of Hell...the pain...the  pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH, SALLY, LUKEY AND McDERMOTT stand by while JOHN AND open THE RUSTED GRILLWORK OF AN AIR-VENT in the ground. T to swing his upper torso completely down inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY hangs up-side-down in A RUSH OF AIR. He tightens A H over his nose and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Okay. Lemme have 'em. A LEAF BAG is passed in from above. TOBY flags the bag op OF FLOWER AND POLLEN DUST FLY through the tight space, su into the duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OCCASIONAL PIECE OF FLOWER blow into the room. There are SIX TECHNICIANS AND TWO SECURITY GUARDS posted stations. A RADIO MAN looks up.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO MAN
dialogues.text: What's that? Smell it?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Dunno. Must be comin' from outside. Kinda  nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only TWO GUARDS posted at the sealed entrance. eating from A CAN OF SPAM. The other is reading an old, d PLAYBOY. A RIFLE BARREL jabs suddenly into "Playboy's" ba

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Don't move! It's JULIE GRANT, Mary's disgruntled assistant. A YOUNG M behaviouralist in a WHITE LAB COAT is with her. They both RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Open the outer door. Move it! "Playboy" slowly gets up and starts towards A CONTROL PAN last minute, he spins around, grabbing JULIE'S GUN BARREL it away. JULIE'S YOUNG ACCOMPLICE swings his RIFLE BUTT a "Playboy" cold. Then he trains the weapon on "Spam man" a JULIE moves to the controls, examines them, trips A TOGGL "LOCK" and pushes A LARGE GREEN BUTTON. THE DOOR TO THE OUTSIDE SWINGS OPEN. Beyond is blackness occasional patch of MOONLIGHT ON JUNGLE GROWTH. JULIE wal carefully toward the opening. Just as she is about to cro threshold into the night, A HUGE FIGURE leaps at her, gra RIFLE and enclosing her in a strangle hold. It's DIESEL. comes JACK, his RIFLE (Sarah's rifle) levelled off at JUL FRIEND. "Spam man" makes a break for it down the hall. Reacting n too quickly, JACK FIRES. "SPAM MAN" IS HIT SQUARELY IN TH pitches forward, dead. THE YOUNG SCIENTIST raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell.....? JACK FIRES ANOTHER BURST and the ORANGE CIRCLE ON THE YOU CHEST SHOW A DOTTED LINE OF RED. He flies back, a surpris expression on his face, and he flops, dead, right on top "Playboy" guard who is lying near the control booth.

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH
dialogues.text: THE DOC comes slowly out of the night guiding SPIDER over threshold and into the hall. LOGAN reminds us of a crazy Houston, floating on air in a madman's bubble.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What...what is this? Who...?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: It's alright, it's alright, my dear. You've  simply helped us do the Lord's work.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN'S SHOULDER WOUND IS BLEEDING THROUGH ITS DRESSINGS
dialogues.text: doctor, on a holy mission, seems to feel no pain. He guid into the light and opens her shirt. DIESEL shoves JULIE a wall. JACK covers her with his AUTOMATIC. LOGAN removes RED-SOAKED DRESSING from SPIDER'S skin. All bare chest and upper belly we see LONG, EIGHT-INCH SCARS, STITCHED WITH SUTURE SHOWING. Beneath each is A CIGAR-SHA where a vial of nitro has been implanted. The woman stand crumbling legs, her arms open outward, a grotesque lampoo stigmatic.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What...what have you done to her?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: God forgive us. Forgive us the pain we  inflict as surgeons. We'll be in Heaven,  child. Soon. We'll be with Him in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER
dialogues.text: Na...na...ak...aaaaaaaaaa... SPIDER is trying to signal something. She has seen that " crawling into the control booth. LOGAN follows her alarme

dialogues.speaker: CAN'T
dialogues.text: LOGAN charges toward the booth. THE GUARD is half-in-half glass chamber, his hands reaching for the control panel i starts to kick him, again and again.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Outa the way, Doc! Outa the way! There's vengeance on LOGAN'S face. He's kicking THE GUARD but that doesn't stop the man from reaching the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOOR to the jungle starts to swing closed. DIESEL dives a can't stop the steel slab. It slams with A LOUD THUNNNNNG JACK swings into another position to get a clear shot and LONG BURST into the control booth. "PLAYBOY" IS STRUCK BY ROUNDS. He bounces around in the booth and collapses to t dead. LOGAN, his SHOULDER WOUND POURING BLOOD, aggravated by hi exertion, falls to floor himself, in a faint.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: DIESEL
dialogues.text: Keep the woman covered. JACK levels off on JULIE again. DIESEL moves over to SPID FRESH DRESSING from LOGAN'S BAG, the big man begins to pa SPIDER'S BLEEDING CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A BLINKING RECTANGLE OF RED LIGHT. Written on i ALARM - GATE 7. A BELL RINGS LOUDLY in the room. THE SHOT we see FIVE MEN, all slumped, unconscious, none able to r alarm. ONE OF THE SECURITY GUARDS has made it to THE EXIT. He ma push the door open, but then he falls in a heap. A RADIO MAN staggers into A WEBBING OF WIRES, then he too THE OTHER SECURITY GUARD inches his hand towards A LEVER PROTECTIVE COVER. He flips the cover up, then collapses. action causes his fingers to trip the lever. A HUGE KLAXO BLINKING RECTANGLE, huge over the doors, reads: GENERAL A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual scene here, GASPARILLA AND HIS COURTESANS enter COUNCILMEN AND THEIR LADIES. THE KLAXON SOUNDS over THE L MUSIC. MARY HENRIED, a prisoner for the evening again, he SOUND. Her eyes widen. She looks over at RHODES, who jump feet. The party gradually goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES
dialogues.text: Don't be alarmed. We're impregnable. Stay  where you are. Nothing will happen to any  of you. You're safe here. Men. This last word to A SMALL UNIT OF FOUR TROOPERS standing EXIT. RHODES goes steaming through the doors. TWO OF THE FOLLOW, THE OTHER TWO unsling their RIFLES and take up po outside in the corridor. THE STEEL DOOR SLIDES SHUT locki GASPARILLA AND HIS COURT inside the gymnasium...MARY HENR them.

dialogues.speaker: GASPARILLA
dialogues.text: Well, c'mon, ladies and gents. Who says we  gotta let our evenin' get spoiled? Simon  sez...GET DOWN!!! MOST OF THE GUESTS are willing to let the party get back swing. GASPARILLA grabs A TOPLESS COURTESAN and rocks his around in an attempted dance. MARY seems to be the only o about the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even outside THE KLAXON CAN BE HEARD. TOBY AND THE REBELS their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: That's the general alarm. Jesus! They musta  got in!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What you wanna do?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Come on! THE GROUP moves out urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CIRCULAR LIGHT BLINKS GREEN with A BUZZING SOUND. THE T GUARDS punch up A VIDEO MONITOR. The screen shows TOBY TY LUKEY holding PISTOLS on SALLY AND BILL McDERMOTT.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (into intercom) What's goin' on? TOBY (filter) (on video) LET US IN. THERE'S BEEN A

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I know him. That's Tyler. TOBY (filter) (on video) FER CHRISSAKE! LEMME IN, DAMMIT!

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST GUARD HITS A BUTTON AND THE BIG STEEL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: OPEN. THE REBELS storm in like an ocean wave taking the h GUARDS completely by surprise. They knock them unconsciou their WEAPONS. TOBY pushes A BUTTON which causes the oute swing shut, then he leads the band down the corridor. They go through A DOOR about a hundred yards from the ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of the WORK CORRIDORS that TOBY mentioned ear REBELS run, single-file, deep into the Cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE GRANT has been ROPE-TIED to an eyelet in the wall. down A PISTOL AND A BOX OF AMMO beside DOC LOGAN who is s the floor beside the control booth. He's having trouble c breath. His WOUND has turned his ENTIRE FRONT RED.

dialogues.speaker: DIESEL
dialogues.text: You'd hold us back. We have to go on.
